name: Editor-in-Chief: Harold Jaffe
text: Harold Jaffe is the author of 28 volumes of fiction, docufiction, and non-fiction, including Culture Porn, Goosestep; Death Caf√©, Sacred Outcast: Dispatches from India; Revolutionary Brain; Induced Coma; Anti-Tiwtter: 150 50-Word Stories; Paris 60; Jesus Coyote; 15 Serial Killers; Beyond the Techno-Cave, Terror-dot-Gov, Straight Razor; Eros Anti-Eros; False Positive; Beasts; Mourning Crazy Horse; Madonna & Other Spectacles; and Dos Indios.

name: Associate Editor: Matt Fowler
text: Matt Fowler grew up outside of baltimore, maryland. their work has appeared in online and print publications including Glittermob, Homology Lit Mag, Sycamore Review, and elsewhere. they live in san diego, california with their partner and four dogs.

name: Associate Editor: Kurt Kroeber
text: Kurt Kroeber likes to put words into sentences, paragraphs, etc. He‚Äôs not published in any fancy literature magazines, but doesn‚Äôt really seem to give a care about that rat race (or at least that‚Äôs what he tells himself so he can sleep at night). Kurt writes for the We Are: The Guard music blog and in his spare time creates the Movie Novelization version of films currently in theatres. He co-wrote the feature film Psycho Sleepover which you can watch free on the internet if you are tenacious enough and have an affinity for schlocky horror-comedies. Happy Birthday! Follow him on twitter at @wwwkurtcom.

name: Associate Editor: Laura Mazzenga
text: Laura has a professional background in journalism, and worked in healthcare communications for the majority of her career. Her history in news-reporting gives her a clear, literal voice which still lingers in her writing style. Laura loves writing about people, particularly insane or ill characters, and enjoys the study of people and relationships both on and off the page. She also loves traveling, spending time in nature, and trying to read her cat‚Äôs thoughts üò∫

name: Associate Editor: Angela Pankosky
text:
Angela Pankosky is a Polish writer, mother, and dancer. She earned B.A. in Comparative Literature from SDSU in 2011 and is currently a graduate student in Creative Writing with emphasis in poetry. Her biggest literary influences are Ana√Øs Nin, Halina Po≈õwiatowska, and Helena Raszka.
You can read one of her latest poems, ‚ÄúSnuff yourself‚Äù in the January 2018 issue of Le Scat Noiror "The Brother" in the San Diego Poetry Annual Anthology. Also check out one of her short stories "Between Borders" in the most recent issue of pacificREVIEW!
